The hot scorched arid savannah. A group of children at play. Tribal children who, without help of the titles could be from any age. They run through a tiny village of huts and thatch, playi version of tag, it would seem. One child is it, than another. Each trying to avoid bein tagged though never going far enough away to miss the fun One girl in particular. A PRETTY GIRL OF 12, is tagged an immediately shunned. She chases kids this way and that, but to no avail. She i not strong enough, nor agile enough, to win. It is clear the other children know this and it begins to make them giggle. The giggles become laughter and the laughter becomes a ta and before we even realize, the inherent cruelty of child let loose becomes evident. They have now formed a circle, at first avoiding her touc with distance, but now growing tighter with menace. Soon is no longer the thing to be afraid of, but the thing tha should fear. In the unspoken manner of children at prey, group begins to chant in their native tongue - a song we not heard but sung in a way none too inviting. The girl now moves to the center of the circle, no longer wishing to tag anyone. ONE DEVIOUS CHILD seems to get an idea. He picks up a sma stone and tosses it at the Pretty Girl. Another child fol suit and then another. Before long, mob rules gives way a stones are being tossed and then thrown. Small and then larger. It grows to the brink of frenzy, the laughing and the shouting not too unlike the noise of the previous scene. So much so, we may miss the first flake of snow. The chil certainly do. It is snowing for a good half minute before last of them stops. By then, the snow is thick as flies and wafting down to m instantly on the hot African soil that has never seen sno before.

Adults come out of their huts and in from the fields and whole of the village is soon gathered round the little gi staring up at the clear blue sky and the snow that falls nowhere. From nothing. One by one, all eyes fall on the little girl and the look curiosity become looks of fear. Of superstition.  Punctuated by a solid thump. And then another, AN OLD MAN looks down at his feet and sees a tiny, missha ball of ice, no bigger than his eye. Be looks at it, then bites it, then pops it in his mouth - breath turning to steam. Another such chunk of ice pops him on the head. THE CROWD LAUGHS. They look up again and see that mixed with the snow are t pellets of hail, seeming to increase in number as the sno mysteriously wanes. And the pellets are getting larger. Until they land as hu Then bricks. And when the first one brings blood to a YOUNG BOY'S brow they scatter. The girl drops to the ground and covers her head as hailstones the size of coffee cans plow into the Earth as well as the weaker shacks of grass and mud. Before long, hew a path of destruction that devastates the village. And all along the girl sits huddled in the dust, crying. hailstones fall in a circle around her, never coming clos than ten feet or so.

ONE MORE SKY. This one a backdrop. Cheap paint and tissue paper hung with hooks on a wall just behind the basket on full court. As we pull back, we see the skyline of New York, crudely out with its silhouette buildings of dark gray and black windows of yellow. Among the famous landmarks represented is the Statue of Liberty, complete with a real lightbulb burning in the to We are at a prom. The theme is RHAPSODY IN BLUE and the d has made tragic efforts to show it. The tablecloths are b the napkins are blue - far too many of the tuxes are powd blue, and the blue eyeshadow is as heavy as expected. Peter Gabriel's "In Your Eyes" gives painful indication t the era, but here it is, nonetheless:
MOVE ACROSS THE FLOOR and through the swaying, clutching, sweating dancers to the bathroom. Through the door to the usual -

Several boys are here, bowties undone - undipped in most cases. Smoking, drinking from whatever inventive containe was used to smuggle in booze. Breath freshener and Visine the chaser. Some of the guys are rolling joints while others make the effort to wave smoke away. Who are they kidding? It's a f in here. MOVE DOWN THE ROW OF TOILET STALLS to one in particular. we find A FRECKLED KID standing in front of mirror, clear holding himself up from the effect of God knows what. He talks to his friend in the stall behind him.
Man, you are something else. What's the matter with you? His friend is on the toilet with his head in his hands. H seems to be in some pain. He is SCOTT SUMMERS - AGE 17.
My eyes... my eyes are killing me. The Freckled kid offers a small plastic bottle.
You want some Vitine, man?

My... eyes. He knocks the bottle away. The freckled kid looks and sees that Scott's eyes are watering so badly that tears are literally streaming thro his fingers. He goes back to the niirror to look at his own.
they're burning...  The freckled kid turns back to him.
Dude, how much did you smoke?

I didn't smoke anything. Scott looks up, taking his hands away, revealing for an instant that his eyes are merely bright red embers in his head. Featureless but for the color. Freckles takes a step back.

A blinding flash of light shows through the frosted glass the double door and cuts through the crack into the dark the gym. All who see it are stunned. Frozen. A lingering moment of confusion, then: BOOM, the doors to the Boys Room burst open and the occup scatter into the gym.

Freckles is still there, legs locked. FRECKLES' P.O.V. He looks at Scott who is now crying meekly in the stall. The door swings closed TO REVEAL: A SMOKING, MOLTEN HOLE in the stall door, framing Scott's face perfectly.

The typical assembly of G.O.P. creeps. A lot of long chin and attempted charismatics. The room is crowded with press and the like to the point there is very little room to even move. It is quite simil to another sort of hearing from days past, only this time Senator in charge is not a drunken paranoid, but a very s one. SENATOR SCOTT FRANK KELLY sits in the middle of it all ha mastered the media much better than those around him. Thi why he is the chosen front man. Just behind him sits ROBERT GUYRICH - clearly a man behi the man whispering almost constantly in the Senator's ear

(amplified via microphone) The X-factor... also know as the imitator gene, exists within every creature on the planet. A VERY SIMPLE IMAGE OF A GENE. Very simply drawn. It has, literally, a "switch" drawn on it and the words "ON" and

It is the gene which tells our bodies whether to change or to stay the same. It can be, literally, turned on or off, depending on whether or not it receives the appropriate cues from the environment. One example is the weather... WE SEE graphic images making this clear, we see COLD WEAT and a PRIMITIVE MAN WITH A LOT OF HAIR.

For instance, as the planet gradually warms up, people whose mutator genes tell their bodies to adapt appropriately will live on and continue to multiply. Others will die out. Gradually, the species will change. As the graphic changes and depicts WARMER CLIMATE, the HA STARTS TO DISAPPEAR ON THE MAN'S BODY.

Normally this process takes thousands and thousands of years. It is the reason we have evolved from homo habilus... FOOTAGE REFLECTS THE VARIOUS STAGES OF HUMAN EVOLUTION. Accompanying it is a GRAPH with a DIAGONAL LINE indicatin the ascent of the "human being" as we know it. Accompanyi the graph are evolving images of the "evolution of man. WOMAN'S AMPLIFIED VOICE (0O.S.
...to homo erectus, to hoao s<piens neanderthalis, and, finally, to homo sapiens sapiens.
PACKED with reporters and photographers. There's a DAIS ~ raised panel of SENATORS вЂ” and a second, lower PANEL. T where the "experts* are testifying.
A strong, attractive* woman in her early 30's. Lobbying f mutant rights, she addresses the room. A simple placard before her: JEAN GREY. GENETICALLY ENHAN RIGHTS ASSOCIATION.
But there's a problem..
The trajectory of the diagonal line changes: at a point marked "homo sapiens sapiens" the line flattens.

Once we humans stopped adapting to our environment and began adapting our environment to suit us вЂ” in other words, once we started making clothes, building shelters and using heat... QUICK SHOTS: early huts, early clothing; then early homes later homes, air conditioning, cars, modern high-rises; e
the imitator gene went into dormancy, and mankind itself stopped evolving. And hasn't, for thousands of years.
On the room, the reactions, and on JEAN herself.
Until now. Jean directs her LASER POINTER to the words "PRESENT DAY, where the "evolution line" has resumed its rise.

For the first time in millennia, the earth is changing faster than our ability to keep up with it.  10. FOOTAGE: HUMAN BEINGS, now, like the animals earlier, hav MINOR "MUTATIONS": we see IMAGES of minor "POWERS"- someo who can seemingly MOVE SHADOWS with his hands; Uri Geller BENDING SPOONS; someone else who appears to be able to SI PAPER WITH HER EYES; someone else who can briefly MAKE AN OBJECT BLUR AND THEN REFOCUS...

These are but a few of the reasons we are seeing what some are calling the beginnings of another stage of evolution. A GAVEL bangs on the dais. A MICROPHONED VOICE interrupts Bearing down is the flamboyant SENATOR SCOTT "FRANK" KELL conservative from Florida, and the hearing's Chairman.
You' re avoiding the question I posed to you at the beginning of this hearing. Ms. Grey. Three words: Are mutants dangerous?
Considering it is the agenda of this committee to register mutants as though they were -

It is the appointed task of this committee to present to the President a comprehensive report that he may best decide weather or not to pass a registration act. We are not here to weed out mutants. We are merely hear to assess their potential threat - if any - to national security. Another SENATOR (LUCINDA ROWEE) speaks into her microphon
Ms. Grey, to what extent are these mutations actually a threat? Jean takes a beat; processes the question. Then:
Some mutations manifest themselves as powers, but these are remote in the extreme. Most are merely physical alterations.
But are they dangerous.  11.
A person driving a car can be dangerous.
Well, we do license people to drive? A LAUGH from the gallery.

But not to live. Kelly has been waiting for an opening like this and is re He raises a blown-up photograph: a grainy, super-zoomed, somewhat obscured image of a CAR ON A FREEWAY which appea to have "melted." Now he's really playing to the crowd.

This was taken by a traffic control video in Orange County. A man in a minor altercation literally melted the car in front of him. I don't know where you come from, Ms. Grey, but where I come from, you don't go melting people's cars when they cut you off. You do it the old fashioned way вЂ” you give em the finger. But what you presume to tell this committee -
I presume nothing. I am here to tell you that in time, the mutator gene will activate in every living human being on this planet. Perhaps even your Children, Senator.

I can assure you, there is no such creature in my genes. The room LAUGHS. Kelly mistaken thinks it is for him, unt the double meaning occurs to him. He is momentarily embarrassed, but he quickly recovers.
That was funny, I have to admit. You certainly seem to be amused, Ms. Grey.
To be frank, Senator, I am tickled. The ROOM LAUGHS, good-naturedly.  12.
I wonder how tickled this committee would be to learn about your associate Professor Xavier. Jean reacts now, surprised to hear these words from Kelly
Or about his so called "school for the gifted." Come now, Dr. Grey. As you are so open to disclosure, share with the people here the purpose of this school. Jean quickly collects herself.
There is indeed a... a school specifically designed -

For mutants. Is that not correct, Ms. Grey? The Senator now gestures to the monitor which now display MASSIVE ESTATE MANSION BEHIND A HIGH IRON GATE. Mutters of confusion from the crowd. Jean bows her head.

In fact, a school whose student body is almost entirely these so-called remote cases. Remote in the extreme, I believe you said. So remote, the location and purpose of this school was, until this very moment, unknown to the American people. The confusion is finding focus. And the focus is Jean.
That was simply for the protection of the students who -

Who what? Who what, Ms. Grey? Who melt metal with their minds, perhaps control human thought? what goes on in that school that no normal person has been allowed to set foot inside? Who is this Professor Xavier and what exactly is he preparing these mutants for?  13.
Professor Xavier is without question the finest -
Answer the question, Ms. Grey. What goes on in that school?
Education. Enlightenment.

Enlightenment indeed, well, I'll put this to you, Dr. Grey. I an of the thinking that this Professor Xavier is an extremist. Nothing more than a Michigan Militia-man with a degree and some very "extreme" parlor tricks. Tricks he does not yet want the world to see. Now the crowd has chosen it's side and Jean is not on it.
There are some things the world is not ready to -

Ladies and Gentlemen of the press. Members of the committee. I put it to you that any mutant left alone may indeed be harmless to our national security; But if history has taught us anything.- power unchecked is power to be corrupted. Unless we begin immediately to take action against the efforts of people like Dr. Grey and this... this Professor Xavier, a minority of a few thousand may very well be organized against a population of millions - totally unprepared for whatever unearthly perversions await them. The crowd reacts loudly in support of the Senator's pontificate. Some cheer, some roar, some yell obscenities Jean. He starts at Jean, delivering his last.
They are very real. They are among us. We must know who they are. And above all, we must know what they can do.  14.

text: PLACID SNOW, mountains in the distance. A magnificent vis suddenly disturbed by movement below. A FIGURE RUNNING AT INHUMAN SPEED. A moment later ANOTHER FIGURE ENTERS FRAME. Larger... moving slightly faster.

An anomaly, to say the least. A man whose features are so much like an animal, one would think he had animal in his blood. His hair is course and black, sprouting wildly fro his head. He is LOGAN. We will come to know him well. As as we can. Then to the thing following him. So much like an animal himself, he makes Logan look perfectly human. Larger, fiercer, somehow inherently more savage. This is called SABERTOOTH. The reasons are obvious'. Teeth like said animal and clawed fingers to match. Mutants of course. Two who must certainly be members of a class "remote in the extreme."

Logan hits a slope at full speed, making it most of the w proper before sliding the last of it on his heels. At the bottom, he comes to an awkward skid on the frozen of ice that is a lake at other times of year. He makes an agile footed run across the ice, but adjustin has closed the gap. SABERTOOTH LEAPS and leaps far, overtaking Logan and land on his back. FEROCIOUS TEETH SINK DEEP INTO LOGAN'S SHOULDER. A scream fills the wilderness for miles. Blood flows. Sabertooth, in a bloodlusting rage, slams Logan down only smash a whole in the ice with his prey.  15. Logan clamors free and dives under, caught instantly by t current and swept away.

Sabertooth stares at the hole in the ice in frustration. the cat he resembles so closely, he watches carefully, suddenly making out bubbles under the surface, trailing a Be is quickly after them, clawed feet working as cleats i the ice.
Logan struggles, already short of breath and at the same trying to swim madly from the shadow above. The muffled s of feet pounding like a heartbeat.
Sabertooth stops again... Listening, looking, searching w senses sharpened beyond that of human comprehension. Be smiles.

He droves a monstrous fist through the ice and reaches in to his shoulder.... searching.... SILENCE AGAIN. Then a violent yank. The ice gives way to the soaked and frozen Logan who struggles to free himself from Sabertoot grasp. A large creature dwarfed by a larger one, he is hoisted in the air, claws tearing his neck.

Logan's right hand. His skin ripples and pulsates, trembl from cold... or perhaps something else. SUDDENLY, three steely claws, some nine inches long, spri from the very flesh just above the knuckles. A stunned pause as both he and Sabertooth look down at th menacing rake. Then Logan drives it home, sinking up to his hand into Sabertooth's side. A HOWL unlike anything ever heard and Sabertooth throws L away from him, the claws tearing across his ribs as he do so.  16. Logan flies several yards before hitting the ice and slid several dozen more. Be is stopped by his head as it hits rock on the far shore. Sabertooth skulks over to him, taking a hand away from th gash on his side in time to watch the fatal-looking wound heal as quickly as the sealing of a Ziplock bag. With the sound of Sabertooth's breathing comes the rising the wind... Snow from the ground begins to swirl in the bitter cold a Sabertooth is nearly upon Logan now and the wind rises further, until he must shield his eyes from the bitter, i As he approaches, we see the fresh claw marks on Logan's healing before our very eyes, leaving not so much as a scratch.

Lightning? No. Lightning is not red. Sabertooth looks around, puzzled, then down at Logan's motionless body. Then to his feet where a hole in the ice spouts bubbling water. The wind blows so violently now that he nearly misses two figures standing only a few yards away - mere silhouettes the icy haze. A closer look tell us it is a man and a woman, THEY WEAR STRANGE UNIFORMS of form-fitting material - the man wears reflective visor that hides his eyes. The woman's face is bare, revealing dark skin and penetrating eyes. ANOTHER FLASH - one that seems to come from the visor its An intense beam of red light. Sabertooth looks down and s the ice at his feet has melted - more accurately been mel away. Be plunges through the ice like a mark in a carnival dunk tank. The more he claws at the edges f the hole, the more flashes of li-jht make the hole t ger. Hi* massive weight hairy coat quickly suck him down. The TWO FIGURES - CYCLOPS AMD STORM - obviously two of th children we saw earlier now grown - stand over the whole calmly watch Sabertooth gather himself and swim back to t surface.  17. Storm looks down at the hole, concentrating her intense g The wind whips further, and her skin dimples with goosebu as the temperature drops and the water in the hole begins freeze. Sabertooth manages to smash through and again, Cyclops fi a beam of light to rob him of an edge to grab on to. Storn then further forces the temperature down, freezing ice thick and thicker.

Sabertooth pounds violently as the ice above him drives h further and further down, becoming more and more a wall between him and his prey. Finally, he wisely concedes. With one last look at the two mysterious figures now near obscured by the ice, he tuns his body and swims away with same agility he had on land.

text: Cyclops and Storm walk over to Logan and look down at him curiously, observing the metallic claws that seem to grow of his flesh. More puzzling is the way in which they retr vanishing into holes in his flesh which heal as quickly a the wound in Sabertooth's side. LOGAN'S P.O.V. They look at one another, wondering. Logan's eyes begin t close as they obscure the last of all perceptible detail.
Finally giving way to white - a slice across the middle w widens and finds some clarity

Logan slowly opens his eyes and winces at the assault of white light.  18. LOGAN'S P.O.V. A simple, white, acoustic tile ceiling with -soft white fluorescent lights. As he gains more focus, a woman's fac comes into view, seeming to hover above him. It is Jean Grey, inspecting him more than looking. Then another face. This one on the front of a shiny, bald head. PROFESSOR XAVIER as we will learn. An intense and intelligent man just to look at him. Finally, from the top of the frame comes another head. Th one covered with hair. In fact, this thing is covered entirely in hair. All of it blue. If not for the small glasses on its face, we might think it was a grizzly with die job. This is BEAST. What else are you going to call h Logan looks to Jean and Xavier, still groggy.
Am I dead?
Miraculously, no. Clearly no the answer he wanted.
Well, there's always tomorrow. Jean and Xavier glance at one another.
Who... who are you? Xavier holds up a set of dog tags on a chain.
Whose are these? A relative? Your grandfather perhaps?
Mine. (Looks at Beast, realizing) What are you? Beast takes no offense. Be simply grunts and smiles, Xavi looks at the dog tags, puzzled.
Where am I?  19.
Sleep, Logan. And he does.

Beast and Jean Grey wear Surgical scrub suits, gloves and masks. Logan is on a flatbed x-ray, the red, lighted crosshairs beading in between his eyes as images are taken over and over. Jean Grey looks down and sees Logan's hand pulsating in m the way it was before. Suddenly, the skin parts and the steely claws come slowly out and then retract. She looks up at Beast who is already looking at them, ama When the claws retract entirely, the skin heals quickly. Beast lets out a "hmph" of interest and picks up a scalpe He makes a tiny incision on Logan's arm which heals as fa as the blade can cut. Then he makes a deeper one, longer, again until he is making a cut six inches long and a full inch into the muscle. It heals in seconds.
Logan's hand. A claw involuntarily emerges. A VICE GRIP comes into frame and quickly grabs it, guidin to a voce and clamping it there. Beast turns the crank wi all his strength to hold the claw fast.

Jean Gray rolls in platform work bench with an adjustable drill. She wears thick safety goggles. They bring the carbide tip down and start to grind away a the claw. The drill heats accelerates, then snaps.

Beast covers his face with a welding visor and ignites a torch. He gives the claw a good twenty seconds of intense acetylene before he stops.  20. He takes a gloved finger and touches the blackened metal. scoring wipes away to reveal the unblemished metal.

Jean and Beast now staxid back in a corner of the room be Scott Summers (Cyclops), no longer in the uniform we firs saw him in, but workout sweats. The visor seems to be a staple, even when casual. He looks at Logan in the far corner of the room and focus on the claws. AN INTENSE READ BEAM IF ENERGY shoots from the visor and blasts away at the claws. - this time longer than the blo torch and the drill combined. No damage. Not even a scratch. Curious, he looks over to the wall, REVEALING FULL BODY X RAYS . Push in until we start to see details of the full skeleton - obviously Logan's, betrayed by the claws along forearm. It is clear the skeleton is not normal. Only merely human its form.
For the first time we see him full frame and realize Xavi is in a wheelchair. He sits at his desk, puzzling over the dog tags that Loga claimed were his.

The dog tags. Nothing odd about them at a glance. Military dog tags, weathered and beaten, but certainly plain. Canadian Military, Logan's name, rank and serial, number. odd thing is the date of birth. 12/4/-- No year. His thumb feels the indentation of the word at the bottom the tag that does not seem to fit here. WOLVERINE. Jean knocks on a door before entering.  21. Xavier looks up from behind his desk and waits.
Well?
I think it's time to rewrite the periodic table.

The Periodic Table of Elements. A chart made up of blacks depicting the elements and their chemical symbols.Among t standards like Gold (Au) and Iron (I) and Oxygen (02) is new square on simple red construction paper tacked to the top. It contains simply a large letter "A".

We are in a laboratory of sorts, quite different from the we just left. MORTIMER TOYNBEE, a dim, loyal thug whose agile leaping ability, and superhuman strength have earned him the name TOAD, lazily reads the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit issue. long tongue shoots out вЂ” zip вЂ” and turns the page. Across the room, JOHN ALLERDYCE, a wiry, red head whose ability to control fire with his fingers has earned him t name PYRO, is watching TV as he casually weaves a lighted match in and out of his fingers like a magician manipulat a coin. They are a bestial and sinister bunch. In the corner we s BLOB, no explanation needed, devouring a BUCKET of cereal precariously balanced on his huge belly. All of-them sit within sight of:

A fantastic device which occupies a hallowed space in his lab. It is meticulously designed, and, with its intricate circuitry, wires, and power boards, it resembles most clo (and only resembles, because, truly it's like nothing we' ever seen before) a combination of a microwave oven and a fantastic light source вЂ” only far sore dark and forebod They all watch the television. CNN in fact.  22. The image on the screen is a helicopter shot of ELLIS ISL with Liberty island and the famous Statue in the backgrou

After years of tension and criticism of U.S Policies from abroad, preparations are nearly completed tor the upcoming fiftieth anniversary gala celebrating the formation of the United Nations. With nearly every invitation confirmed and more coming every hour, the occasion promises to be the largest single gathering of world leaders, if not the first ever in history. Truly an achievement for the President who has made it his administration's agenda to firm foreign relations. The Celebration will be held on Ellis Island - a symbolic gesture from the President who welcomes the nations of the world to a more open and accepting United States than in recent years. Blob belches his skepticism deafeningly and the others la TRACK FURTHER THROUGH THE LAIR AND OUT THE DOOR as the Newscast drones on. Through subterranean corridors (of course) and past dozens of projects that share some similarity to the machine we have seen, including crude designs that have been rejected or stripped of their good ideas. FAINTLY, we become aware of a clicking sound. Almost like stopwatch very far away, always growing louder. The newscast has faded and another voice is getting close from somewhere down the hall. Sabertooth emerges around a corner headed toward us, turn just as we get to him. The clicking is loud and clear now and the sound of the v is familiar, it is the voice of Professor Xavier.

(on t.v.) ...merely as a means of helping those with these rare and wonderful gifts to learn more about their abilities that they may control them and use then for the betterment of all mankind.  23. Sabertooth enters an office and we follow him. Seated at desk in the center of the room is MAX LENSHERR- - age - somewhere after sixty, but strong and vital for his years is more of ten called MAGNETO. Xavier is on the television beside him and he seems to be watching it with vague interest. He has heard it all befo In fact, the graphic in the corner reads.
But some have said you are training a race of superhumans. indoctrinating the genetically enhanced into some strange cult.

(talking to t.v.) It's called the fellowship of man and it's worse than a cult. It's a growing concern. The clicking is from the sound of an executive pendulum thingy on his desk. The six steel balls that bang onto on another from string supports in formation depending on ho many are let to fly from either end. One ball strikes one end, one ball swings out from the other. Two balls and tw and so on. Slight difference. The formations change with every strik defying physics. Oh, and there are no strings supporting balls, thus defying gravity.
(on television) I can assure you, the only idea I am putting into their heads is the fellowship of man.
Ah ha, you see? Xavier, you bullet-head, you haven't changed.

The opposing view on the topic of Mutant registration is Senator Scott Frank Kelly, of Florida, who claims to support the constitutional rights of the genetically enhanced, but whose crusade to register mutants is gaining popularity.
Now Kelly is on the screen, a graphic reading FRIDAY. Mag shakes his head.

And look at this one. When Sabertooth clears his throat, the balls instantly fr and hover there. The volume on the television drops, though no remote is i sight. He notices Sabertooth's apparent exhaustion, his torn clothing, including the slashes in his side. His look ask "what happened?"
I lost him.
How?
They were there. They knew.
Do they have him? Sabertooth nods, frustrated. Magneto thinks for a moment, sharing the frustration. He reaches over and picks up a s vial.
The hard way. Page one. As he turns up the television, and again, we don't see how, he fiddles with the vial in his hands, thinking. Kelly is on the screen giving good face.
it' s not the mutants per se that I have a problem with.

They, like any minority, have fears and desires like normal people. Bat, it's when their fears are exploited by subversives like this Xavier character. -And mark my words if the President isn't strong enough to do...what needs to be done...  25. As the Senator continues we PULL BACK and see Magneto watching this. He begins speaking over Kelly's diatribe.

And you may mark my words, Senator Scott Frank Kelly. All your plotting, all your hatred. I have plans for you... I have seen your kind before. I've seen you come, and I will see you go. Magneto holds up the vial with the tiny piece of shiny me AS he does, we see THE RED SERIAL NUMBERS TATTOOED ON HIS ARM. PAN OVER TO A BULLETIN BOARD on the wall beside him. TO a periodic table, smaller than the first. But still with that red square and the added letter "A".
Logan, looking better, sitting up. Xavier sitting beside bed. Jean Grey at the floor, looking at his chart.

Adamantium... Until today it was thought to be a myth. Impenetrable, unbendable, resistant to the most extreme heat, cold, pressure and stress. Virtually indestructible. The strongest metal on Earth. Just then, a spoon creeps in to frame toward's Logan's mo with a dollop of food on the end. Logan recoils and brush the spoon away. The hand on the other end is covered in b hair. All eyes look to Beast, who stands timidly with a t of vegetables.
For strength. It's good for you. Logan takes the tray from him and feeds himself. Beast ta a place next to Jean.
Go on.
The adamantium has somehow been grafted to your bones. Your entire skeleton is coated with it. (MORE)
I am assuming your unnatural ability to heal makes this possible. It also makes you virtually unstoppable. Your metal skeleton may also explain why I am having difficulty reading your mind.
Excuse me?
Surely you didn't think you were the only one with... talents, Mr. Logan. He looks at Beast and Jean.
Well I'm sure Babe the Blue Oaf here can make a mean strudel, what can the betty Logan freezes as all of the vegetables on his plate levit and hover in the air above him.
Make you wear your lunch. Logan nods, conceding.
Gotcha. The vegetables settle carefully back in place and he continues eating.
How did the adamantium get into your body? Was it the military? He points to Logan's dogtags. Logan pulls away.
I don't know.
How long has it been there?
1 don't know.
How old are you? Logan is clearly becoming agitated.  27.
I don' t know.
You mean to tell me -
I DON'T KNOW, who are you people? Where am I? What is this place and why am I here? Xavier wisely decides to ease up.
All in time. In a matter in which you can digest. In the meantime, we would like to invite you to stay here as our guest. You are free to go anywhere -
To leave?
I wouldn't do that.
You've suffered serious internal damage - even with your ability to heal -
